1.content:
Your crew of nine approaches the new planet. It looks just like your home on Earth, with oceans, continents, and even a large moon.

Unfortunately you don't have long to enjoy this beauty. As your craft enters the inner atmosphere, it gets a critical malfunction. The navigation controls are damaged. The fuel pods are being eaten away by friction. Your ship is going to crash...

It is heading for...
1.title: Critical Malfunction

choices: into an open bottle of beer
11.content:
As the ship continues entry, the fuel pods burst open and the friction has started a fire. If you and your crew stay in any longer, you will die long before the craft crashes to the surface.

So you open the airlock and jump out. As you descend, you can see six others jump out. Eventually, the spaceship explodes in a fiery nova above you.

All you can do is hope and pray the last two survived somehow.

You turn away from the explosion and look where you're landing

You're heading straight for...
11.title: Explosion

choices: a speedo-clad lifeguard walking towards you
111.content:
You land safely on the sand. As you stand to check for any damages, you catch a glimpse of something close to you.

It's...
111.title: 3 Point Landing?

choices: He doesn't see the ship and runs on by.
He sees you running into the ship and takes the whole thing!
He sees the ship, but thinks it's junk and throws it away
1111.content:
You had done a quick scan of the surrounding landscape and found nothing - and that's all you needed to get out and make repairs. You wanted off this planet quickly, whatever the hell it was.

But your scanning equipment covered...limited range on this gargantuan planet. Yes, there was nothing that close by, but 300-foot tall joggers? They could cover a lot of ground very quickly. So while you communicated with the rest of the crew who were scattered around the ship, in places like the engine room, cockpit etc, you were outside, trying to fix the ship's heat shielding conductors - and you were the first to see this gigantic runner. He was black, wearing swimming trunks and a shirt. Why he was jogging over here, you had no idea, and you didn't want to wait to find out. You had hesitated for several seconds upon seeing this enormous figure, trying to convince yourself it wasn't real, that you hadn't landed on a planet of hulking giants, that it was all a stress-based hallucination. But the vibration of his footsteps getting closer and closer, and all the more devastating, changed your mind. You didn't have much in the way of escape options, but the ship might provide some protection. You yelped and sprinted back inside, almost having to wade through the heavy sand.
1111.title: a jogging sandal-wearing college hunk

11112.content:
You got inside and shut the door just inside to hear a deep, bass-filled voice say "what the hell?!" and you gulped. That really wasn't good.

"Everyone strap in! We have a giant alien attacking the ship!" you yelled into your radio.

You got to your cockpit and strapped in just in time to see a huge, black hand coming towards the ship. It soon covered the entire window, leaving you in darkness but for the lights coming from the various computers and machinery. You whimpered in terror, wondering what possible fate might await you in the clutches of this huge monster of a creature.

It got worse. The giant picked up the ship - which must have been only about 6 inches long to him - and brought it up, and up, and up. It was an extreme acceleration and you grabbed the arm of your seat so aggressively that your knuckles turned white.

As quickly as it had gone, light returned to the cockpit and you dared to look out the window once more. Before you was a gigantic face, which alone was bigger than not only you, but the entire ship. You were paralyzed with fear as the giant's eyes grew wider and wider as he truly realised what he had encountered. "Whoa," he breathed, and the breath battered your window. It was at this point you realised the window had shutters, and you quickly hit the control, sealing yourself away from the terrifying - yet handsome - face. You flicked the light on.

"I saw you already, lil man." You heard the words loud and clear, but it sounded like they were more the giant talking to himself than to you.

You were rocked constantly as the giant tucked the ship under his arm and moved quickly back to his nearby house which he shared with 5 friends. Once he got inside, he bolted up to his room, locked the door and put the ship on his desk.

Sheer terror overtook you. The ship had no weapons and it couldn't fly. Leaving it would be tantamount to suicide. You realised now that you had absolutely no control of this situation. You quietly spoke into your radio. "Stay hidden on the lower decks," you said. "He's only seen me. I can say it was a solo flight and at least you all might be able to escape." There were protests, but you turned off the radio. To you, that was your duty - to protect your men. You hadn't even thought twice about it.

How did the giant treat his little find?
11112.title: He sees you running into the ship and takes the...

choices: Jordan's nightstand, wrapped in a blanket made of cloth
111121.content:
"Hey there," the giant voice rumbled. You didn't respond.

"I don't know if you can understand me in there, but I'm not going to hurt ya," he said. You could hear the tone of excitement in his voice - this was clearly quite a thrill for him.

You still didn't respond, so you heard him sigh. "I'm not stupid, lil man. I saw you run back into the ship and close the door. Then I saw you in the cockpit before you closed the shutters. I know you're in there."

He was right, you realised. You'd made eye contact. There was no escaping the fact that he knew about you...

The surface you were on began to rumble rhythmically. You thought you were being picked up, but when you turned on a nearby monitor and activated the external cameras, you realised it was just the giant drumming his fingers impatiently on the desk - with progressively more force.

You didn't know what he would do next, but you did know that you - and the ship - were totally at his mercy. So you took a deep breath and reached for your ship's tannoy button. You took a deep breath, comforting yourself with the understanding that if nothing else, and whatever happened, you were the first Earthling every to talk to a creature from another planet - even if this planet looked basically the same as Earth but a lot bigger.

Clearing your throat, you pressed the button and said, "this is Captain Troy Marcus of the good ship Exodite. We-um, I, crash-landed on your planet. I am sorry for any inconvenience. Please do not harm the ship."
You heard the giant exhale suddenly and he muttered, "whoa," again. After a moment, he said, "hi, uh, Captain. I'm Jordan. Could you open the shutter so I can see you?"

At this point, it was pointless not to. You opened the shutter and you were confronted with the giant's enormous torso and, looking up, his handsome face. The expression was curious, but soft, his eyebrows knitted together in concentration. He leaned down, taking a good look inside the cockpit, and you made eye contact again. He grinned a brilliant wide smile and you waved back hesitantly. "Hi there, Captain Troy," he said, his grin widening. He was almost laughing. You wished you shared his mirth.

"Do you think you could come out of the ship?" he asked,

You had to admit you were quite taken with his wide, earnest eyes and his hopeful smile, as well as the absolute power he was effortlessly exhibiting. His arms were well-muscled and shown off by his shirt, and sweat glistened on his forehead, beneath close-cropped hair. But despite that...

"I'm...I'm sorry, Mr. Jordan, sir, but how do I know I can trust you?"
His grin faded and became a frown. "I'm pretty sure I could break the ship in half if I wanted," he said and you blanched in terror, unbuckling your seatbelt. "But I don't want to. I'm asking nicely."

It wasn't even a threat - it was a statement of fat, and it was absolutely true. "OK," you said, and you ran to the hatch of the ship without another word.

You took yet another deep breath and opened it up before walking out onto the giant's enormous desk. You turned to face him, your knees buckling beneath you. You felt awfully exposed without the ship.

Jordan laughed disbelievingly as you walked out. It was as if the sight of you moving around on his desk confirmed that you were real. He leaned in still further, so his chin and square jaw rested gently on the desk. You took several steps back as the face was uncomfortably close, so close in fact that you couldn't take it all in. His grin widened, flashing brilliant white teeth.

"Don't be scared," he whispered, "Relax. Big ol' Jordan will take care of you."
"I-I-OK-"

"So where did you come from, little man?"
You were about to explain when you fainted.

Where did you wake up?
111121.title: Gentle God

1111212.content:
When you came to your senses, you were on a warm, spongy yet strangely leathery surface. You had no idea what it was until you opened your eyes and saw Jordan, the giant college kid who'd found you, right up close. You were in his hand! His face dominated your vision and you gave a sudden whimper.

The enormous brown eyes, like great orbs of curiosity, widened and you heard a sigh of relief just below you. "You're awake!" he exclaimed, and you covered your ears in pain.
"Oh, sorry. You're awake," he repeated again, at barely above a whisper. You nodded. "I was gettin' worried about you, little man," Jordan chuckled.

You groggily tried to get to your feet on the hand, but it was a struggle. "Hey, don't strain yourself," Jordan cooed softly. "Relax."

He was talking to you as if to some kind of hyper-intelligent bug. It was incredibly patronising, but you supposed, well, you were a hyper-intelligent bug on this planet. And like you thought before, it was better to keep on his good side, so wearing a big chip on your shoulder and getting pissed about it wasn't going to help.

You stood precariously on the hand and stared into the eyes, then looked down at the palm you were stood in. It was amazing, really; every detail stood out to you. The lines, the pores in the skin, all of it. It was bizarre to see a human being in this level of detail. Or whatever species Jordan and the inhabitants of this planet were. I mean, were you in another planet? Or had you just shrunk? Or had you travelled to some parallel universe? You had no idea. The ship's navigator was best-placed to answer, and he was presumably still inside the ship.

Jordan carried you over to his desk and put you down on it. He smiled down at you and you forced yourself to smile back.
1111212.title: In Jordan's hand

choices: "Hey dude, I'm not a little beast!"
11112121.content:
"I'm going to feed you first.... After all, you're my guest!" he chuckled. The giant teen, by mentioning "feeding", was actually referring to his little "guest as a little beast, rather than a sentient being, but again, you thought it was better to not protest. Besides, he was already walking out of the room.

He came back after just a few minutes, carrying two plates and a bottle. When the bigger plate was placed before you, the impact on the table caused (from your perspective) a defeaning boom, and a tremor that nearly threw you off balance. Then, you saw the food: fruits, vegetables and cheese of many types, beside bread, ham and tuna, all cut into tiny pieces... well, each piece was actually almost as big as you!

Jordan placed the smaller plate, which was empty (and wide enough to serve as a landing Platform for your ship) beside the other one, saying: "I don't know what you eat, so I gathered a bit of everything... By the way..." he added, pouring a white liquid into the smaller plate, "Do you drink milk?"

You answered:
11112121.title: Giant dinner

choices: "We can make repairs, but we might need the giant's help."
11112122.content:
"How about you try and fix your ship, Captain Troy?" Jordan asked gently as you stepped off his hand and back onto the cool, wooden surface of the desk.

You looked up at him and shouted "ummm...ok, sir!"
"I don't know if you need my help, but just ask me, ok? I'll be on my laptop."

And he pulled the most insanely large laptop up from the floor and put it slowly down on the desk next to you. You gulped as you stared at it - it alone was 3 or 4 times larger than your ship! The bizarre exaggeration of everything on this planet was truly a sight to behold...and to be terrified by.

Jordan flashed you the brilliant wide smile again, as if to say "what are you waiting for?"
You took the hint and headed inside the ship and down to the engine room to report back. Your crew assembled at the entrance and listened raptly as you told them Jordan was peaceful, but also impatient and that you hadn't told him about the rest of the crew. He'd allowed you back into the ship to make repairs. The crew seemed shocked, frightened.

It was at this point you asked for news, and the head engineer stepped forward to provide a damage report.
11112122.title: Making repairs

choices: The crew votes to stay with Jordan
The crew votes to fix the ship and leave Jordan's room
111121221.content:
You hesitated for a moment, unable to quite process those words.
"We're STUCK here? What? The damage to the ship wasn't that bad!" you exclaimed.

The engineer shook his head. "It's not about that," he said. "There was a spike in our magnetic readings about 20 minutes before we landed. We were too busy to analyse it then, but I had another look. Turns out we went through a wormhole. That's why a planet that's basically the same as ours only about 50 times bigger can possibly exist."

"OK," you said. "So we go back through the wormhole. They have two entrances. What's the issue?"
"There are several. First, we'd need way more power to escape this planet than we did to escape our own. That's just basic physics, this planet is way, way bigger. And, second, and the thing that means we're well and truly stuck here - the wormhole is closed."
"What? How can a wormhole just...close? What the hell?"
"I don't know. But we've done a long-range scan the place we had that energy spike and there's nothing there now."

You held your head in your hands in despair. You sighed.

"OK," you said. "Then we make the best of it, keep scanning the atmosphere and hope it comes back."
"That's it?" asked your navigator.
"What do you want from me? I can't make wormholes appear in the sky."
The navigator fell silent.
"How do we 'make the best of it'?" asked an engineer.

"Well, uh...Jordan seems like a good guy. I mean, he's in college, so we'll have to be careful in case he has any wild parties or anything like that. But...I don't know, I think he'll look after us. I mean, if he wanted to do something bad he would have by now, right?"
"So you're putting all of our lives in the hands of some college kid?"
"We don't have much choice. If you want, we can fix the ship, leave, and go find somewhere remote to set up camp, but...I dunno. He'll keep us comfortable and give us three meals a day, I think."
"He's in college."
"OK, maybe just lunch and dinner, but still."

Your crew of 8 shook their head. "It's not much, but that's where we are for now. We'll take a vote. Do you guys want to trust in Jordan, or fly the ship somewhere else and set up camp somewhere remote, somewhere away from all the giants?"
111121221.title: "We're stuck here."

choices: Admit to him you have a crew.
Keep the lie going, and let the giant decide what to do next.
1111212211.content:
Reluctantly, 6 of your 8 underlings, and you, voted to stay with Jordan. You nodded. "OK. Good. I'll go...tell him, I suppose."

"This is a mistake," said navigator Henricks.
"Listen. This is my ship. I didn't have to be democratic, but I was. Now shut up and await your next order. You got that?"
He nodded, cowed, and your Executive Officer, Adam Jacobson, winked his approval.
"You have the deck, Jacobson," you said, and left the ship.

You took a deep breath and walked out of the ship, back away from normality and out into the bizarre giant world.

The giant, Jordan, was still typing away at his laptop and he hadn't noticed you yet. You took several deep breaths, still terrified of talking to him in case he decided to swat you like a fly. You shouted up to him, "...Mr. Jordan, sir?"
He turned in his seat and looked at you, that smile on his face again.

"Yes, Captain?" he asked. You weren't sure if he was being patronising by recognising your proper rank, or respectful, but it was best not to question it. Either way, you told him the bad news.

He leaned forward.
"Oh man..." he said, and there was some genuine sadness in his voice. "So you're stuck on this planet forever? You'll never be able to get home?"
"Unless the wormhole reappears...and even then, who knows where it'll take us."

Jordan shook his million-ton head. "I don't know what to say. Space is weird, dude."
It was a layman's description, but you basically agreed.

After a minute or so of silence, you noticed Jordan break into a slight smile. "Ah well. Now you can stay with me! You can be my little pet. I can get a hamster wheel for you, a cage...it'll be dope."
You began to protest, but Jordan sat back in his chair, laughing.
"Hahaaaa, I got you good, little man."
He noticed the concern on your face.
"C'mon, I'm not a monster. Hell, you're probably smarter than I am. I know you don't need a cage. Jeez!"

You were relieved, your heart still pounding, and smiled slightly despite everything.

"See, it ain't all bad. Some horrible douchebag might have found you and ACTUALLY done all that stuff. Or worse." He grimaced and then shuddered, and you nodded profusely, knowing how true those words were - and feeling guilty that's what you thought would happen the minute Jordan found you. You had been lucky he was such a good guy - or so he seemed thus far. You could tell he was excited to have you around, and that he wasn't completely upset you couldn't go home, but you also got the sense he definitely would have allowed you to leave if you could. And you supposed you couldn't blame him for getting a little excited to have a tiny spaceman living in his room.

"Alright, Cap," he said, and you still weren't sure if that was respect or condescension, "what do you want to do now?"
1111212211.title: The crew votes to stay with Jordan

choices: Jordan gets why you hid them. But now he wants to meet the crew!
Jordan is pissed off with you. The Honeymoon's over!
11112122111.content:
"Um, Mr. Jordan? I have a little confession to make."

Jordan knitted his eyebrows together and leaned in, looking a little concerned. "Well...you see...this wasn't a solo mission," you called out loudly. "I was scared about what you might do, and I wanted to protect my crew from any harm, so...I mean it was a last resort to try and make sure they at least got away..."
"Man, Cap, you lied to me? That's lame," he said, his eyes widening. You felt horrible for disappointing him. It was like disappointing a puppy dog.
"We were just scared, Jordan. They're my responsibility. I swore to their families I'd keep them safe, and you're..."
"Black?" he asked, and you weren't sure if he was kidding.
"No!" you exclaimed "A giant! You're terrifying! I fainted when I first spoke to you!"


Jordan considered. You hoped this wouldn't ruin your relationship with him. Surely he understood why you did it?
11112122111.title: Admit to him you have a crew.

choices: Seeing all of the crew was too much for Jordan - he starts to abuse his power.
"Do you guys have Pizza on your planet? You want some?"
111121221111.content:
Jordan frowned and tilted his head as your heart pounded in anticipation. You prayed he'd understand.

He sighed. "I guess I get it. If I saw a thousand-foot beast coming at me I'd be scared too." His cocky smirk returned and you sighed with relief.
"Thanks for understanding," you called up to him.
"No worries, little dude. So, can I meet them?"
You hesitated, but then said, "sure, I guess. Let me go and get them."

So you went into the ship and led the crew out. Though the two people who'd dissented in the vote were initially sceptical, they followed your orders and joined you on the desk.

"This is my crew," you called out to Jordan. "They're a good bunch." You told Jordan their names and he leaned forward, examining each one carefully. You knew he could see the terror on their faces and you appreciated him not talking; that might scare all of them back into the ship.

After a while, he leaned back and said, "good to meet you, little guys."
Nobody said anything in response.
"I'm Jordan."
Again, nobody said or did anything, standing stock-still.

The silence stretched on for a few seconds and you whispered, "hey. Say hi. Be nice to our host."
Executive Officer Jacobson, your second-in-command, took a step forward and hesitantly raised his hand. "Um...hello. Nice to meet you. Thank you for not..."
"Being a douchebag?" Jordan asked, flashing that big smile of his again.
"Um...yes."
"Haha, no worries, buddy."

Jordan rested his colossal arms on the desk and leaned his head on it, simply staring at the crew. His wide, orb-like eyes took each one of the Earthlings in with an exponentially increasing sense of wonder, and a few crew members took fearful, instinctive steps back.
111121221111.title: Jordan gets it. Time to meet the crew!

choices: Adam sails past Jordan's Adam's Apple
Jordan sees Adam just in time!
1111212211112.content:
You looked up in surprise at Jordan's latest question, then after a second realised it was your responsibility to speak. "Um...yeah, we have pizza. You got some?"
Jordan laughed. "Hah, no, course not. But I can order some."

Jordan picked up his mobile phone from the desk nearby and placed an order for a large pizza. After chilling out with you for a while, it came. He paid the pizza guy, then opened the box with his huge arms.

The rich aroma of the pizza assaulted you and your crew, and you all suddenly realised just how hungry you are.

Jordan placed a slice of pizza on a piece of kitchen paper he'd placed on the table, then sat back and looked at it.

"Hmm...that's probably a bit big," he said with a chuckle.

You felt very small, almost like a child, as he took a knife from the kitchen and started decimating the slice, cutting off about a third of it and then cutting that into 9 pieces. The end result was everyone in your crew had a weird, square, incredibly thick, crustless pizza that to you looked about 12 inches in diameter. There was no way you'd finish all of it, but you'd give it a damn good go.

Jordan picked up the remnants of the slice and devoured it in two seconds flat. You gazed up at him in awe and he grinned down at you widely, a string of cheese dangling from his mouth. You almost wanted to laugh at how much of a pig he was, but, again, you were scared of pissing him off - even though you found it more endearing than anything.

"Enjoy your food, little dudes. I'll be right here if you need anything."

As if you needed telling where he was. Right now it seemed like you'd know his exact location from a mile out. You looked up at the giant, wearing his dark blue hoodie and slight smile as he put his headphones on and stared at the laptop, which emitted a blue light. You shook your head a little at his lazy student lifestyle. But he'd given you a lot to be thankful for, not least the pizza, which you now turned towards.

A couple of your guys were hesitant, but you gestured to them and began eating your own, breaking off a bit of the hot, gooey pizza and biting in. It was difficult to eat, but delicious - and tasted just like back home, which pleased the crew as they joined you. All 9 of the crew, for the first time since you'd landed, seemed relaxed.

Then disaster struck.

Jacobson drifted too close to the edge, so when Jordan's knee caught the table as he leaned forward, Jacobson was knocked from the safety of the wooden furniture you were on to the perilous floor below. "Adam!" you shouted out. You ran to the edge, praying he was something other than a bloody stain on Jordan's bedroom floor.

In actual fact, Jacobson had fallen into the pizza box - which was on Jordan's lap. At least his fall had been broken by the gooey cheese.

But now he was stuck fast in the greasy, slippery substance and, worse, Jordan was picking up that slice of pizza. He was looking at his laptop, headphones on, completely dead to the world. He reached down, wrapped his enormous hand around the crust of the pizza and slowly brought it up to his face.

You could hear Adam's anguished cries, but you knew Jordan couldn't. The entire crew began to panic, yelling, screaming, jumping around, trying desperately to get the attention of your giant host. "Jordan!" you yelled out. "JORDAN!"

He looked at you, eyes widened in surprise. You had his attention, but he had already opened his mouth, preparing to take another of his decadent chomps.

Does he get the message in time or does he chomp down and eat your crewmate?
1111212211112.title: "Do you guys have Pizza on your planet?"

choices: Later that night... [Jordan requests a private conversation with the Captain]
11112122111122.content:
With one hand, Jordan took off his headphones and, seeing you pointing to the slice of pizza in his hand, looked down on it. He went cross-eyed as he examined it, and after a second realised Adam was waving frantically at him, stuck fast inside it.

Jordan's eyebrows nearly shot out of his head. "Agh!" he gasped, nearly dropping the slice. He regained control quickly and gradually, slowly, pinched Adam out of the pizza slice.

"Dude, I nearly ate you!" he said to the little man dangling in his hand. You didn't think Adam needed telling twice.
"How did he end up on the pizza slice?" Jordan asked. You shouted up your explanation, and Jordan looked at Adam - who he'd placed back on the desk - with scrunched eyebrows and a disapproving expression. "You need to be more careful, little guy." He reached out with a finger and gently prodded Adam, who stumbled back and fell over. "I don't know how I'd live with myself if I ate one of you guys! But...yknow, sorry I almost ate you."

"It's alright!" Adam shouted, picking himselfup and trying to dust the heavy cheese out of his uniform. "It was my fault!"

Jordan returned to his pizza and one by one, your crew retreated back into the ship, leaving the giant to his own devices. You did the same, waving and indicating where you were going. Jordan nodded and gave a thumbs up.

The crew weren't happy. You had to placate them and remind them it only happened because you were fed by the giant in the first place, and that everyone, including Jordan, would have to be extra-careful as long as you were on this planet.

The dissenting voices were growing, but you shook your head and refused to let it bother you. They were your crew, and they'd obey. You headed to Captain's quarters, at the top of the ship - with a small window that allowed you to see out into Jordan's room, and lay down with a big sigh. The sooner the wormhole came back, the sooner you'd be out of there.
11112122111122.title: Jordan sees Adam just in time!

choices: You roll into his crotch; this excites him.
He stops you. Time to sleep in a giant's hair!
111121221111221.content:
You felt yourself drifting off to sleep when the ship shook all of a sudden. You yelled out in shock, and looked out of the window to see Jordan's finger.

"Cap?" you heard him ask. "You there?"
You felt a pang of fear, but also, weirdly, of excitement, as you went over to the window controls and activated them. Your window slid open and you popped your head out of the window.

"Jordan! Down here!" you yelled out.
Jordan's eyebrows narrowed and he bent down. Pretty soon all you could see was the enormous, handsome face of the college kid in tremendous detail.

Recognition crossed his features and he flashed his brilliant white smile. Before you could yell out in protest, two of his unfairly huge fingers had gently lifted you clean out of the window! You yelped, but Jordan responded with a "sssshhh...it's OK."

You didn't know what was happening apart from the fact Jordan was moving, but it was over as quickly as it had begun. You were placed on another piece of furniture, but this was Jordan's bed-side table. You took a minute to compose yourself after the ride, and then looked up. It was then you realised Jordan was naked, except for a pair of boxers that he presumably slept in.

His body was a sight to be hold; he took "tall, dark and handsome" to a whole new level. He had well-defined abs and pecs and his arms were more impressive out of his shirt. His body seemed to ripple with power. He wasn't some enormous muscle freak, but he clearly took care of himself and he looked damn good for it. You let out a breath as he looked down at you for a second, then climbed into his bed. You got to see the enormous legs in action now, the thick thighs generating a huge amount of energy and power. You hoped to god Jordan's species of giant never found your planet, you realised. It would be the end of us all.

You were slightly confused by why you were here until Jordan reached out and lightly brushed you into his hand, then sat up in bed and held you near his face so you could talk.

"So," he whispered. "First night with Jordan the giant. You holding up OK?"
You nodded and gave him a thumbs up.
"Good stuff. Hope the crew are OK. Sorry I almost ate your dude earlier."
"Oh, don't worry about that," you called out.

There was awkward silence for a moment, then Jordan suddenly turned his hand to the side and you were, suddenly, standing on his well-defined chest, struggling to keep your balance. You let out a shriek as you looked into the billboard-sized, handsome face.

"I've been thinkin, little dude," he said. "I don't like you sleeping in the ship. I feel like any bug could just crawl in there and cause chaos."
You started to protest, but Jordan overrode you.
"So I'm gonna put you in my hair. You'll be safe there,"
Again, you were about to protest, when Jordan sat forward and you went rolling down his chest.
111121221111221.title: A private audience

choices: Act on it; take steps towards the crotch. Jordan catches your meaning and grins.
Don't act on it; step away. Go to sleep. Jordan remembers the feeling.
1111212211112211.content:
The world is shaken around into a whirl of darkness as you tumble down Jordan's torso. You have no idea what is going on, until you land on...soft fabric. You pulled yourself onto all-fours. "Wha..." You were quizzical, wondering if this was the bedspread, before you smelt the whiff of something very ominous...

You looked down and saw red. Literally red. The colour of Jordan's boxers. You were standing on his crotch!

But it got worse...you felt the boxers stretch and expand beneath you and you struggled to keep your footing. The floor got somehow sturdier, but you knew what this meant. He was getting a hard on!

"Whoa," Jordan said, and his voice quivered with thrill and excitement. "I ain't gonna lie, you feel real good down there, Cap."
You blanched. You moved forward a little quicker, but you'd been in college. You remembered how horny you were around that time...you expected any minute for a hand to impede your progress as you take a few steps forward, but it never comes. Eventually, you're able to hop off the rapidly hardening dick and onto Jordan's well-defined stomach.

"Fuuuuuck," he said. You can still hear the cotton straining behind you and it takes all your willpower not to look. Just how big was this thing? And just how turned on were you making the giant? It was crazy.

You feel triumphant having made your way onto one of the damp, stinking jocks, instead of being buried under the weight of dozens of them.

It's a short-lived triumph. Before you can plot another move, you feel shadows fall over you again. You gulp and look up.

More jocks! Where did this group come from?

"No! Wait!"

But, they don't see you, let alone hear your puny voice.

Several strong, muscular and massive arms reach out and drop sweat-drenched jocks into the receptacle.

An avalanche of the protective sports gear buries you, yet again.

Your only hope is that he leaves, which will give you the chance to get back to your ship and the crew. Faced with this crazy, giant world, you would rather trust your luck in the company of others.

Alas, it isn't to be.

The giant lowered one of his burly arms and curled his fingers around the jockstrap. He sat on the bench and pulled on the jock in one fluid motion. He crowded himself into the jockstrap, which was a tight fit but good for nestling his equipment beneath his other clothes. He also quickly pulled on pants and a shirt before finally slipping into a pair of shoes and socks.

The whole time, you are screaming futile cries of protest as you find yourself pressed deeply between the cotton walls and the giant's enormous equipment.

Your hopes of getting back to the ship are dwindling fast....

This otherworldly majesty is disconnected with the youthful and boisterous energy these masculine beings infused into everything they did. Shirts are flung across the room, bulging crotches larger than the biggest life forms on Earth are grabbed firmly and shaken to hooting and hollering. Their words are nothing but disjointed syllables until your cybernetic suit suddenly receives a year's worth of surveillance data all at once, the missing probe's signal reappearing.

"... best game ever! WE DOMINATED!" A now naked titan boomed from the far corner before grabbing one of his teammates into a bear hug to groans and laughter. 124.content:
Your craft continues its plunge through the atmosphere - as a relatively small scout ship it doesn't have the engines or power to cope with the thick atmosphere and powerful crosswinds of this mysterious planet. The rest of the crew quickly straps themselves in and prepares for the inevitable crash landing while you and your co-pilot battle valiantly with the controls. The landscape below is a blur of colours and you start praying that you can find a relatively open area. Unfortunately, this hope is almost immediately dashed as a vast shape suddenly looms up in front of the ship: it appears to be an immense structure of some kind and there seems little chance of avoiding it. At the last moment you see what appears to be an opening and you yank hard on the controls in an attempt to guide the ship safely through it. There's a shattering sound and your last thought is that there must have been some kind of barrier across the opening...

You awaken a couple of moments later to a strange rocking motion. An unexpected splash of cold water brings you back to your senses: the ship must have crash-landed in a lake or sea and water is starting to enter the damaged hull. You shake your co-pilot roughly awake and then yell at the rest of the crew to start evacuating the craft: you probably only have a minute or two before it sinks! Fortunately there is an inflatable life-raft among the supplies so you blow the emergency bolts on the airlock, toss the raft outside and then you and the others plunge into the water and start swimming away from the stricken craft before the suction pulls you into the depths along with it.

With the ship now consigned to the depths you've pretty much lost everything apart from the life-raft and a couple of backpacks with some tools, rations, a radio, and a beacon. Even though it seems highly unlikely you'll be able to make contact with anybody who could help you four of the crew clamber into the raft and start tinkering with the equipment. Meanwhile you and the others swim a little further away, trying to get a look at your surroundings.

You've ended up in a fairly large body of water, but it seems to be enclosed within some kind of building. The scale is immense - you guess you must be inside that massive structure you saw before you crashed - and you can see daylight streaming in through several openings in the far distance and high above. The lake itself - if that is what it is - seems to be surrounded on every side by high walls, without any kind of shoreline. You can't see these barriers clearly as you are too far away (you seem to be pretty much in the center of the lake), but even from this distance it is clear that you have little chance of being able to climb them. That could be a real problem. Apart from everything else even the water doesn't feel quite right: it seems thicker and heavier than you'd expect with quite sizeable waves. You risk a small mouthful and spit it out in disgust due to an unpleasant chemical taste - it isn't saltwater but you certainly won't be using this for drinking!

Suddenly, there's a violent crash in the distance and a thundering sound that quickly resolves itself into a commotion of deafeningly loud shouts and cries. All of you turn round and watch in horror as a group of COLOSSAL TITANS strides through a towering gateway in one of the distant walls. You're not sure which is more shocking: the fact that they look exactly like humans, or the fact that they are unbelievably and terrifyingly huge! They're so huge, in fact, that you guess that you and your crew are certainly no more than half an inch tall by comparison. The titans are naked, apart from what appear to be tight speedos, and their sheer size only serves to emphasize their well-defined muscles and other... bulges. A suspicion quickly starts to grow in your mind: despite their immense scale they somehow look exactly like an ordinary college swimming team from Earth, which means that this must be... their swimming pool! You've crashed on a world of giants and are now little more than helpless toys bobbing up and down in the middle of a vast pool! At any moment the giant swimmers are likely to catch sight of you and your crew and then the fun will really begin...

You walk towards the sound and draw your weapon, hoping to investigate in order to protect your crew. You put two and two together, finally realizing what the charging sound down the hallway is, and call back to your team, telling them to go back into the ship and lock the doors. You run and hide under a changing bench.

The first boy that rounds the corner seems to be of the all-American variety, with a hard jaw line and very well defined muscles under his singlet. His blue eyes shine from under a mess of blond hair, which flops lazily over his forehead.

He is soon followed by another, far more muscular boy with deep-set brown eyes and short, military style brown hair. His biceps almost burst out of his singlet and his thighs seem to expand with each step. Maybe you are imagining it, but it seems like his chest muscles continue to twitch on their own...

In a very short period of time, the entire locker room is filled with 18 year old kids, and the smell of sweat has multiplied almost tenfold. You try to get back to your ship, it is gone. Either your crew fixed the navigation system, or it was found by a kid you will never know.

15511121121.content:
You blinked, hoping to god you'd heard what you thought you'd just heard.

"What?" said the bodybuilder, staring down at his four tinies with intense power. He was breathing heavily.

"Think about it," said your giant. "These guys might be small, but they can travel through space! Think about what we could learn from them! And if we do something bad, their planet might invade with their...I don't know...space guns, or whatever."
"I guess..." the bodybuilder said, disappointedly.

"They're freaking ALIENS, dude! This is cool! We shouldn't just waste it by abusing them."
The swimmer nodded. He raised you up to his gigantic, handsome face and looked right at you. You tried to hold his gaze, but it was seriously intimidating.

"Can you understand me? My name is David."
He said the words very slowly, as if to a stupid person. "Yes," you shouted, hoping the giant could hear you. You cleared your throat before continuing "My name is Captain Troy Marcus of the Exodite. Our ship crash-landed here and we were trying to make repairs when you giant fellas walked in."

The giant couldn't help but laugh at your pomposity. "Hello, Captain Troy Marcus of the Exodite. Don't worry, me and my friends will do everything we can for you."
You heard more of their rumbling, giant voices as you realised the other two were following your lead.
"Mike," said the swimmer.
"Victor," said the bodybuilder.

"Alright," David breathed, his inquisitive eyes not leaving you. "We know each other's names."

You suddenly lost your balance in the enormous palm as Dave moved it towards his other hand and tipped yours, so you landed next to the ship. "Get inside, little man. I'll carry you home in it."

You wanted to protest, you wanted to be left here, but you also knew that the giants might offer the best route of escape from this planet. And you knew you were better off keeping these guys happy. That bodybuilder, Victor, had been a little bit too keen to abuse his power.

So you shouted "thanks!" and climbed into the ship.
You hurried to the cockpit and strapped yourself in - in the nick of time, too, as Dave began to raise the ship to his face, shaking you about. You were once again confronted by those curious brown eyes. Once he spied you in the cockpit, he grinned and put the ship down on the bench.

From outside the bench you heard Dave say, "guys, put em down. Let them get back in their ship."
"Alright," said Mike. You stared up through the cockpit window. The bench was below knee-height, and looking up you could see Dave's entire naked form. You couldn't help but be a little excited by his power, his dominance, and his slightly-swinging mammoth dick. Now you knew these guys were just people, not monsters, you realised how unbelievable attractive Dave in particular was.

The other two, not bad-looking themselves, bent down and let your crew go. Before you knew it, they were back in the relative safety of the ship and you breathed a small sigh of relief.

"Let's go," said Dave. You saw him pull on a pair of boxers, which pressed against his genitals, forming a tight bulge. The others followed the same, dressing themselves.
15511121121.title: "We've got to help them," he said.

155112.content:
You have your crew seated and buckled throughout the free-fall towards the new planet. Gritting your teeth in the master seat, you command computing to shutter the windows and reduce damage to the critical areas of the ship.

The rattling of the ship rattles your very body, jostling your bones and causing your stomach to jump. Falling blind, you feel and hear a sudden smash against the cockpit.

That's not normal. The ship smashed through something solid. But you have no time to check until a final jolt nearly launches you from your buckle straps. "Cut the thrusters!" You shout to engineering.

Engineering reports. "There's no need. Thrusters are gone!"

"Gone?" You try your best to calm the crew.

"Gone! Flewed the coop! The main thrusters were smashed off when we fell!"

You recall the descent. "We fell through something as we descended. Any idea what that was?"

"Maybe we should open the shutters..."

You command computing to tell the ship to open the shutters. There is no response.

"Computing core is shot. No good!"

You unstrap yourself from your seat. "I guess there's no other option. Until the core gets restored, our best option for damage reporting is physical - internal and external."

You adjust your legs to an inclined cockpit floor. "One engineer comes with me outside with a small exploratory force." As you reach for a helmet. "The rest of you spread out and report any damage to the ship. Once we know what's wrong, the sooner we can get off this rock."

Five handy-handed crew mates, one engineer, and the captain himself exit the damaged hangar bay onto the new planet...
155112.title: The Crash

1551121.content:
The hangar gate buckled during the crash and the ship lay beached partially on its right side. There is no smooth small steps for you and your crew onto this new planet. It didn't take much for you or the team to get the picture of the external damage. The main thrusters have been sheared like it went through a cheese grater. It must be a miracle that the fuel tanks themselves have barely been scratched - a note to limit any electric or incendiary devises when the core is reactivated. The external hull is buckled and part of it is gone completely. These are not good signs.

You see some of the culprits around the crash site. Your crew kicks and moves around large jagged boulders to salvage anything useful from the debris. The craft went through something solid.

A topographic analysis gets reported to your helmet as you examine the rock formation around the crater. "Light level is low, maybe overcast. Moisture level is 80%. It looks like we crashed into a canyon of some kind...or cave."

"Never seen any cave this size on Earth," you report. "Look at the rock strata here..." Out to the horizon you see colossal pearl white squares divided by miniature furrows stained green by the indigenous life.

"Or that..." The cartographer points to some colossal crude structure almost like a modernized Greek columnade supporting a top shelf. Must've been made by an ancient race that went extinct long ago - why else was this not built into something like the Parthenon?

Suddenly, the ground shakes. "EARTHQUAKE!" The cartographer panics and runs beneath the alien Greek structure. You and your crew follow him. Better to stick together than to go alone. The earthquakes seem sporadic - like they start and stop suddenly. The loose parts of the ship rattle with each seismic jolt. A shadow falls just shy of the crater and an organic structure strikes the ground. "This must be the source of the quakes," you try and calm your comrades as you slink along the structure's shadow for a better view of this anomaly...

It is a foot - human physically, but at a scale beyond comprehension.

Your eyes follow up and you wish you didn't see what you saw.

Your ship lies next to the right foot of a colossal woman. You can discern the shape of her breasts and a bit of her chin and hair. She is a brunette with long curls draping about shoulder length. You can't help but notice that her limbs and belly are something else - visibly muscled, thicker on her arms and thighs but not so much for her belly. This titaness is athletic stepping into bodybuilder.

Your crew creeps closer to the crash site except one - your female engineer. You realize why. She has no clothing except for a massive dense cloth draped around her neck with both ends draping over her breasts. Water runs down her muscled thighs and belly. She must be saturated with water with columns of steam rising off her skin.

Over the com you hear the engineer scoff under her breath. "Pigs..."

The giantess creates a rainstorm as she shakes drops of water from her hair onto the crater below her. Then she pauses. Clutching the ends of the towel with both hands, she turns her nose up. Nostrils flare. Does she smell the leaking fuel? The heat of entry? Does she see the crashed ship just beneathe her?

Protocol gets breached when one of your handimen removes his helmet into the planet's unknown moist atmosphere to cat-call.

The titaness slides her towel over her breasts and crotch. Her eyebrows furrow. Her voice is like thunder. "Who's here?"

A foolish action endangers the lives of your crew. One option runs through your mind...
1551121.title: The Encounter

1553.content:
The ship dives into the atmosphere. Alarm klaxons sound throughout the ship.

It's clear the ship is going to crash. Scanners detect a massive body of water. Is it going to crash into the sea?

At the last moment, navigation computers find a strip of land.

Miraculously, the entire crew survives the crash landing. As the captain, it's your job to take charge of the situation.

As instrument reports filter from various stations, the extent of the catastrophe is glaring. The ship's finished, the engines having been shorn off by the rough crash.

One of the technicians manages to activate an exterior camera, which at least gives you a view of the terrain. From the scene on display, it appears the ship has crashed into a sea of sand. Towering dunes reach for a vivid blue sky. Strange vegetation nods and sways in a breeze. The strange "forest" is comprised of "trees" with smooth golden trunks topped with strange drooping fronds.

According to the manual, now is the time to send a team to ascertain the exterior surroundings. Two of the red-shirted security detail are called to the operations center.

"Schaef, Bland," you address the security officers, "just take a quick look and see what's out there."

They took a portable cam to transmit back progress of their excursion onto the alien planet. Surrounded by the crew, you keep your attention focused on the screen. You watch as the two men broadcast a difficult ascent to the top of the first dune.

Doubts surface. "Maybe I should have sent a more experience team," you mutter, only to have your mental debate cut short when you hear Schaef's scream.

One of the technicians, eyes fixed on the screen, shouts. "What's that?"

An avalanche of sand dumps the security team to the foot of one of the dunes.

The technician remains rooted to the spot. "It looked huge!"

For yourself, you are not quite sure what you thought you saw.

Suddenly, another scream, and everything around your security team seems to go dark.

One of the men manages to get the camera turned in time to transmit footage as a giant foot crashes down.

Transmission of images cease as do the frantic screams of the security team sent to its doom.

The technician sounds on the verge of panic. "What was that?"

You have to snap out of it. "That's what we need to know. Analyze that footage. We will discuss the results in one hour."

You feel bad for the security team. They were not the best or brightest, but you have to feel that their loss was a waste. After all, you are now left with fewer expendable members of your crew in the red shirts.

An hour later, you and the rest of the crew face the impossible.

"Repeat that!"

The technician takes a deep breath. "In every respect, except scale, those creatures (footage reveals the group consisted of three male titans) are human or, at the very least, humanoid."

"How big are they?"

The technician swallowed nervously. "Well, to give an approximation of scale, we're no bigger than ants to them."

"So, we are marooned on a planet of giants?"

"There's another possibility," the technician admitted, and he launched into a theory about wormholes and the possibility the entire ship shrank in transit. The alien world is the same scale as the Earth they left behind.

The medical officer erupted. "What difference does it make? Either way, we're screwed. You saw what happened to Schaef and Bland."

The technician shivered. "Stomped like insignificant bugs."

"We were unprepared. Now that we know, we will prepare for a first contact."
1553.title: An island beach

But the time for a decent first contact has passed. The giant feet descended close to the windshield of the ship. For the moment, they stayed motionless. The crew cowered at the great detail of their size. Indeed they were ants on a planet of giants.

Suddenly you hear a loud groan like something grabbing the hull. Your view of the giant's feet disappear as the craft ascends by some force. 15533.title: Noticed

155332.content:
The three guys had taken a boat from the mainland for a camping trip on an isolated island.

They had left the boat on the beach and made their way toward the dunes to pitch camp when they saw the falling object. From their perspective, it looked like a child's toy.

The mystery was where the tiny craft could have originated so far from any settlement. They decided to investigate, which is when the unfortunate crewmen of the Zephyr met their doom below the feet of these titans.

Of course, they had not even noticed the insect-sized visitors at their feet. But, they had noticed the crashed ship.

Matt, the largest of the towering titans, picked up the ship and peered into the vessel. His huge blue eyes blinked in surprise when he saw tiny figures on the other side of a thin windshield.

"There's tiny people in there," he exclaimed.

Of course, on the other side of the glass, the tiny men watched the handsome but massive face in quaking terror.

His two friends crowded closer, but he shoved them back. "Give me room."

Matt took his hand and strained to force open the tiny ship. The hull unraveled like paper from his display of strength.

The tiny crew was left stunned. The titanic youth held out his palm. With his other hand, he lifted the peeled ship and shook the tiny men onto the waiting surface of his hand.

"Amazing!" Matt said in an awesome tone.
155332.title: Matt Uses Force

info.brief_description: Your crew gets stuck on a planet of giants. How do you survive?
info.description:
The story begins when Earth sends a probe to explore a newly discovered planet. The probe was able to find significant life readings, but went offline from causes unknown.

You are on a team with eight other members to investigate this world.

But little do they know that it's inhabited by giants.

-Guidelines-
Sexual encounter is allowable, but keep it away from children and the elderly
Compared to the giants, you are a half of an inch tall. So no size changing
Male and female interaction is allowable
The giants must be human-like physically

Other than that...go nuts!
